intro: Packera toluccana, commonly known as the Toluca ragwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant features basal leaves that are deeply lobed and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Packera toluccana is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
